Cell Source: HepG2/C3A, primary hepatocytes, iPSC-derived hepatic cells
Multiple Cell Types: Usually single hepatic cell type; optional co-culture
Stromal Cells: No (base). Possible if user adds e.g. stellate/fibroblasts
Tissue-resident Immune: No (Kupffer cells not standard, must be added manually)
Notable Features: Long-term viability (weeks–months), near-physiological liver function (albumin, urea), disease modeling (NAFLD)
Plate/Format (Throughput): One 10 mL ClinoReactor per culture, 6 positions in ClinoStar (low–medium throughput)
Max Culture Duration: Up to 10+ months in special cases
Readouts - Supernatant Sampling: Yes (ports allow sampling media for liver enzymes, etc.)
Gas Mix Controlled: CO₂ & O₂ via hypoxia module, remote software control
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Yes (adjust O₂ levels, rotation speed, etc. in real time)
model_availability: Offered as product-based system; user forms model in ClinoReactor

Physiological/Pathological: Both – normal neurodevelopment and disease (microcephaly, viral infection)
Stromal Cells: N/A in brain; no fibroblasts needed
Tissue-resident Immune: Not standard (microglia can be added if desired)
Extracellular Matrix: Often Matrigel at start, then free-floating organoid
Notable Features: Long-term neural differentiation (reduced necrosis), virus infection studies, complex layered structures
Plate/Format (Throughput): 6 reactors per ClinoStar, each can hold multiple organoids (low–medium)
Max Culture Duration: Weeks to months for neuronal maturation
Readouts - Live Imaging: Basic real-time via camera, detailed imaging requires removal
Perfused: No, gentle rotation instead of flow

Organs/Tissues: Various tumor types (lung, colon, breast, etc.)
Physiological/Pathological: Pathological cancer models; drug testing, metastasis, etc.
Cell Source: Cancer cell lines (A549, etc.), patient-derived tumor organoids (PDOs)
Multiple Cell Types: Yes, if stroma or immune cells added; commonly single tumor cell line
Stromal Cells: Not by default; user can add fibroblasts (CAFs)
Tissue-resident Immune: No, must be added if desired (e.g. macrophages)
3D Scaffold: No built-in scaffold; spheroid typically or in hydrogel droplet
Notable Features: Long-term tumor model, drug-resistance evolution, easily adjustable O₂ for hypoxia
Plate/Format (Throughput): One reactor per condition, 6 positions per ClinoStar (low–medium)
Readouts - Live Imaging: Yes (camera), advanced imaging requires sample removal
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Yes (harvest spheroid for viability, molecular assays)

Physiological/Pathological: Primarily embryogenesis, can mimic early developmental defects
Cell Source: ESC/iPSC aggregates or actual blastomeres forming blastocyst-like spheres
Multiple Cell Types: Yes (trophectoderm, inner cell mass, possibly epiblast/hypoblast)
Stromal Cells: N/A (early embryo does not have stroma)
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): No, single embryonic structure per reactor
Extracellular Matrix: Optional minimal matrix if needed for aggregation
Notable Features: Extended culture beyond normal blastocyst stage, multi-week embryology model
Plate/Format (Throughput): 6 reactors, each can hold multiple blastoids (low throughput)
Readouts - Live Imaging: Basic camera view, advanced imaging off-line
Gas Mix Controlled: O₂/CO₂ set by software (5% O₂ for embryonic culture, etc.)
